description: CTO of Facebook. Previously co-founder and CEO of FriendFeed. Programmer, food lover.
name: Bret Taylor

entries.body: RT @Werner: Interesting data from the HTTP Archive: http://httparchive.org/interes...
FriendFeed Blog: FriendFeed now available in فارسی - http://blog.friendfeed.com/2009...

comments.body: FriendFeed is now available in Persian! Thanks again to all of our Persian users — it has been extremely exciting for us to see FriendFeed so widely used around the world. You can set your language preference here: http://friendfeed.com/...
Any way we could auto-translate (or even have a link with the option to?)? It'd be great to really be able to collaborate with the non-English speaking world...
Thank you all .
wow, another language... I can't read it, but that is cool! :)
Now if we could only filter out languages other then our own and have the lang:en search filter.
You're welcome! We are excited to better support our Persian users.
Thank you Bret, we love FriendFeed and happy for add Persian language to FF :)
This feels so good to be able to view the pages in a way are eyes used to see Persian writings. Thank you so much! We really appreciate your effort!  Thanks again ! :)
Yay!
that just looks so beautiful :D
محشره / غافلگیر شدم
wow! thanks!
Anybody know of good Farsi to English web translation tools? Google Translate doesn't seem to do it.
蝌蚪文~~~
Great! thanks thanks :)
Thanks Dude
Agora precisamos da versão em Português.
thanks ((((((((:
Thanks ممنون  ;)
merci bcp .
ممنون
Good job, Bret... Thanks a lot...
Thanks
;) It's FriendFeed.. Bravo - این فرندفید است... براوو
Ok.

Great Bret! I remember that in the past some persian people wrote here that whould be nice to have FF interface also in persian, probabilly because their language is very different and  english  isn't so diffused such in Europe. A welcome to persian friends! :)
Hebrew please. ^^
تشکر جیگر
kiss to you honey

entries.body: Happy Holidays!

comments.body: Dead programs don't get snow logos.
Dead programs don't let you make comments
*ZING*
dead programs don't let you like things
Dead programs don't..... work.
Yay! The graphic has officially been flipped! No need for nostalgia.
Kenndy actually makes a good point here... :)
Merry Eggnog! ... and jeez, what's with the rude comments? It's the holidays. #relax
Maybe I was misunderstood.  I was commenting that the snow logo is proof that FF wasn't (and isn't) dead.
I think everyone knew exactly what you meant jeremy :)
ok.  I was trying to find the "rude" comments...

Jeremy, perhaps there's a misunderstanding.   As a rule, FriendFeeders celebrate Festivus - maybe someone mistook this thread for the Airing of the Grievences ceremony.  In any event, I got a lot of problems with you people! And now you're gonna hear about it!
Hehe
Bring it on, old man.
*gets popcorn*
FIGHT!
A little goes a long way around these here parts. *picks teeth with straw*
Happy Holidays everyone! :-D
Merry Christmas
Merry Christmas
Bump.
like for the bump, ;)
ta...
Thanks much Bret.  Happy Holidays to you too!
Feliz Navidad
I liked it
hey :)

entries.body: If you use the FriendFeed Facebook application make sure you've configured it properly. We are switching to a new method of publishing in the not too distant future. If you see this message at http://apps.facebook.com/friendf... just click on the link to provide the proper permissions. (via http://friendfeed.com/bgolub...)

comments.body: Closer integration with Facebook??
A little late on the info as I deleted this link last week at I was told I was pushing all of my FF to FB people were not happy.
why do you not post the link comments from friendfeed to the wall? just the links loses 80% of the value.

I'm tired the FriendFeed Facebook app. keeps asking me to fix "the problem" so it can post to my wall. I don't want it to post to my wall! Contacts on Facebook and FriendFeed are different types for me. On Facebook it's about being friends in real life, on FriendFeed it is about interests. At least that is how I use FF and FB. My Facebook friends would probably feel I was spamming uninteresting stuff if my FF posts where copied to FB (well, at least if I used FF so intensive as I want to:-))...
Please let us select what to publish on FB from FF?  I'd rather have tweets not appear on FB, particularly as I post from Ping.fm to FB and Twitter.
New publishing method? I hope nothing will change for those FF users who don't use Facebook. (am I alone here?)

I agree with Gregor ... By not having the comment sent with the link, it's just plain and boring and I'd rather just post directly to Facebook. Unfortunately, however, this would negate the very useful benefit of using the "Share on FriendFeed" bookmarklet.
I don't mind it publishing to my wall, but I don't want it to be my status update. It worked fine before y'all fixed it! (Go ahead. Roll your eyes.) ;)

I get that cannot publish message all the time, because I specifically took away its permissions to publish to my wall. If the FF app gave me some sort of control over what it put on my wall, then I'd give it permissions to do so. As it stands, if everything I posted to FF made it to my FB wall, I'd be defriended by 90% of my friends rather quickly.
Yay for new publishing methods!  stream.publish FTW!
I don't want to publish my friendfeed updates to facebook, they're too many. I blocked it and i'm always receiving error messages on facebook.

On the same environment, I saw that lite.facebook.com is fast as hell! With proxies, my comments gets directly inputted while FriendFeed takes a couple of seconds, one step at a time. And the message, as Oscar said, is always present if you decide to stop FriendFeed from posting to said service when you have the application on FB. It (script) thinks it wasn't decided, as if it was the problem in question. Also, I saw that new comments added to the news feed, gets up as with FriendFeed, even if not in total Real-Time, I think it's the best solution, I was more active by looking at earlier posts I liked temporarily and enjoy getting back to them when new content is added. GG on that Bret (if you were somehow responsible for that hehe).
Mine failed to post the most recent entry to my wall for unknown reasons.  (I have it configured to use privatebrlewis@friendfeed rather than my regular brlewis ff account.)
hmmm
damn that must be fun lol :)
Could you add this: http://ff.im/oH1ft please..
I've uninstalled the FriendFeed application and now I cannot re-add it.  I see the friendfeed app for a split second and then it reports an error.
Hacım, the search function is totally down, any news on that?

entries.body: RT @jack: Today I'm thrilled to get back to work at @Twitter leading product as Executive Chairman. And yes: leading @Square forevermore as CEO. #200%
RT @paulg: It's remarkable what a large percentage of our advice at Y Combinator is either "Just tell them" or "Just ask them."
For Today’s Graduate, Just One Word - Statistics - NYTimes.com - http://www.nytimes.com/2009...

comments.body: Carrie getting some much deserved attention. "Ms. Grimes is an Internet-age statistician, one of many who are changing the image of the profession as a place for dronish number nerds. They are finding themselves increasingly in demand — and even cool.  “I keep saying that the sexy job in the next 10 years will be statisticians,” said Hal Varian, chief economist at Google. “And I’m not kidding.”"

Great article, but it left out that statisticians need some CS muscle to effectively operate on large scale data.   It's the combination that make Carrie -- and others like her -- 'Internet-age' statisticians.
Michael, plenty of CS muscle, and also training in specialized packages like/from the SAS http://www.sas.com/technol... etc.
